justification: “Next, participants reported the confidence in their decision on a 6-point scale with the following labels: 'sure error', 'probably error', 'guess error', 'guess correct', 'probably correct' and 'certainly correct' …”
“The next two questions prompted how much participants felt feedback helped them assess how well they performed… Answers for these two questions were made on a 5-point Likert scale.”
“…and how much they felt feedback closely tracked their performance. Answers for these two questions were made on a 5-point Likert scale.”

“The first question was an open-ended question inviting participants to share anything unusual they noticed about the experiment. We considered that participants were aware of the feedback manipulation if they at least reported that feedback values were sometimes high, and sometimes low.”
“Lastly, we checked the level of understanding of feedback by showing an example feedback of 81%. Participants were instructed to select all true propositions within a list.”
